caption:
Table 4. Accuracies on ImageNet and ImageNet Real of CeiT and of several SOTA CNNs and Transformers, for models trained with no 
extra data. The notation ↑ 384 means the model is fine-tuned on the resolution of 384 × 384. CeiT models outperform CNNs with similar 
FLOPs. Directly trained in ImageNet, CeiT models also achieve higher performances than DeiT models that are trained with extra CNN 
teachers.

Table 5. Ablation study results on the type of I2T. Top-1 accuracy 
and changes are reported.

Table 6. Results on downstream tasks with ImageNet pre-training. CeiT models achieve state-of-the-arts performance. The results with the 
first two highest accuracies are bolded.

Table 8. Comparisons of the ability of convergence between DeiT 
and CeiT models. CeiT models trained with 100 epochs obtain 
comparable results with DeiT models trained with 300 epochs. 1× 
means 100 epochs.
